channel.title: Posts on Cecily Liu: STA304
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Cecily Liu: STA304

item.title: Toronto's Crime Rate by Neighbourhood
item.description: Abstract Crime rate is an important measure when determining public polices about safety, or deciding between neighbourhoods you would want to raise your children. In this blogpost, we look at the “Neighbourhood Crime Rate” taken from Open Data Toronto, which shows the various crime counts of neighbourhoods in Toronto from 2014-2019. We can see that despite the smaller population, Agincourt South-Malvert West has a higher crime count in almost all types of crime measured compared to the neighbouring Agincourt North.

item.title: A Plain Markdown Post
item.description: This is a post written in plain Markdown (*.md) instead of R Markdown (*.Rmd). The major differences are: You cannot run any R code in a plain Markdown document, whereas in an R Markdown document, you can embed R code chunks (```{r}); A plain Markdown post is rendered through Blackfriday, and an R Markdown document is compiled by rmarkdown and Pandoc. There are many differences in syntax between Blackfriday’s Markdown and Pandoc’s Markdown.
